I&#39;m prepping for running for my first campaign over Roll20 and wanted to see if folks had suggestions for how best to run DW over Roll20.  Right now I&#39;m thinking we mostly stay on a single main page, where I&#39;ve added some flavor art in the background, as well as an image of the basic moves list and an area in one corner where I can type in the various taking forward modifiers during play.  Any other good resources to keep on the main page where we&#39;ll usually be playing?<br /><br />Only other page I&#39;m thinking I might use is one for a world map view (once we make one.)  For &#39;local&#39; maps I&#39;ll probably just free-draw on the main page and maybe drop some tokens occasionally to help keep rough track of combat situations.
<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/117601525779363207299_photo.jpg'> Patrick Schenk (Leivve)</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-10 14:45:28 (edited: 2016-09-10 14:45:28)</cite></p>
        <p>Use Skype or discord. Roll20 voice chat, though functional should be a last resort.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/102532126904257134510_photo.jpg'> Mark Weis</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-10 14:58:01 (edited: 2016-09-10 14:58:01)</cite></p>
        <p>What <span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/117601525779363207299" oid="117601525779363207299">Patrick Schenk</a></span> said, except don&#39;t use skype. I have only ever had bad experiences with it.<br /><br />Also, i always put the basic and special moves as Handouts in their journals.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103667855585775066713_photo.jpg'> Aaron Griffin</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-10 15:05:30 (edited: 2016-09-10 15:05:30)</cite></p>
        <p>For PbtA games, I keep one main page that has imagery and important things for the campaign - an r-map or series of images for locations. I also usually keep a list of issues the characters are dealing with in case they get lost as to what needs doing.<br /><br />I make handouts for each individual move so I can &quot;Show to All Players&quot; when a move fits.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/104561179674739270437_photo.jpg'> Dan Bryant</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-10 15:09:05 (edited: 2016-09-10 15:09:05)</cite></p>
        <p><span class="proflinkWrapper"><span class="proflinkPrefix">+</span><a class="proflink" href="https://plus.google.com/103667855585775066713" oid="103667855585775066713">Aaron Griffin</a></span> Oh, cool, so if I select &quot;Show to All Players&quot;, it pops up in the front for everybody?Â  That sounds really useful for moves with choices, particularly Discern Realities.</p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/103667855585775066713_photo.jpg'> Aaron Griffin</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-10 15:14:41 (edited: 2016-09-10 15:14:41)</cite></p>
        <p>Yeah. That&#39;s why I made small images of each move. I guess I didn&#39;t put the DW ones into Dropbox, so here&#39;s one from Uncharted Worlds: <br /><a href="https://www.dropbox.com/s/dq8btjx15znexhn/UW%20Face%20Adversity.png?dl=0" data-embed="CNECCNACCM8CCAASSGh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LmRyb3Bib3guY29tL3MvZHE4YnRqeDE1em5leGhuL1VXJTIwRmFjZSUyMEFkdmVyc2l0eS5wbmc_ZGw9MDqbAQivwqil8SoSSGh0dHBzOi8vd3d3LmRyb3Bib3guY29tL3MvZHE4YnRqeDE1em5leGhuL1VXJTIwRmFjZSUyMEFkdmVyc2l0eS5wbmc_" data-attachment-render-hint="2" class="ot-anchor">dropbox.com</a></p>
</div>
        

<div id='comment z13wypihss2hxvztp23be1hiqwndeldwr04'>
  <h4><img src='{{site.baseurl}}//images/avatars/110285352867085036435_photo.jpg'> Andrea Serafini</h4>
      <p><cite>2016-09-11 07:17:19 (edited: 2016-09-11 07:17:19)</cite></p>
        <p>Use a page for drawing the map. Once the game world is defined, you can create multiple pages with appropriate background pictures with the png and locales that you already defined.</p>
</div>
